body:
So, I decided to make a vid on how to circle strafe with clips from my last vid, since I'm lazy. 
It's short, but informative and for players who are seeking to improve their PvP skills, including skills that I will touch on later in future tutorials, if this one goes well, otherwise I will end the series. If you guys could like, rate, comment and sub if you liked the vid, it really helps my channel grow and shows me that I'm doing something right :). 

Video Link:  http://youtu.be/vXxySZFS2iU 

8-Blocking:http://youtu.be/GdLLn9zH0Kg
body_tagged:

Video Link:  http://youtu.be/vXxySZFS2iU 

8-Blocking:http://youtu.be/GdLLn9zH0Kg
title: PvP Tutorial: Circle Strafing & 8-Blocking

replies.body:
Nice tutorial (:

My only suggestion is to include more clips that aren't slowed down. Slowed down clips allow more attention to detail, but it's nice to see the strafe in normal action. Other than that, great tips and I look forward to future videos c;
replies.body_tagged:
Nice tutorial (:

My only suggestion is to include more clips that aren't slowed down. Slowed down clips allow more attention to detail, but it's nice to see the strafe in normal action. Other than that, great tips and I look forward to future videos c;

replies.body:
Agreed, you'll always learn better from a mentor, but I, personally, got a vague outline from people and how to hybrid blockhit, but I was never given anything solid. All I did was watch vids and felt it out on my own, now 8-blocking is one of my main combos and one of the two combos which are my "trademark" or "staple" combos, and I like to think I'm pretty good at 8-blocking. So no, a mentor is not always necessary, but it definitely helps.  

Ty as well
replies.body_tagged:
